definition: to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

sentences.english: We veteran cadres have the responsibility of making earnest efforts to select successors.
sentences.chinese: 我們老幹部的責任就是要認真選好接班人。

sentences.english: The successor of family business in our country is usually the owner's son or daughter.
sentences.chinese: 目前我國家族企業接班人選擇主要是子承父業的方式。

sentences.english: But one of his successors in the White House had about as checkered a youth as can be imagined.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在白宮他的一位接班人青年時代卻歷盡艱辛。

sentences.english: These leaders are responsible for overseeing all employee training and succession-planning programs.
sentences.chinese: 這些高管負責監督員工培訓及接班人計劃的落實。

sentences.english: He is considered by many people as "song god" Jacky cheung's successor .
sentences.chinese: 他被很多人認爲是“歌神”張學友的接班人。

sentences.english: Builders and successors featuring an all-round development in morality, intelligence, physique and art.
sentences.chinese: 培養德智體美全面發展的社會主義建設者和接班人。

sentences.english: Now the safety culture, a good future successor.
sentences.chinese: 現在安全學文化，將來當好接班人。

sentences.english: So I suggest a Dalmatian as my successor.
sentences.chinese: 所以我建議讓達爾馬提亞狗做我的接班人。

sentences.english: The tailor took him as his successor.
sentences.chinese: 裁縫把他作爲自己的接班人。

sentences.english: The King designated Hussein as his successor.
sentences.chinese: 國王選定侯賽因爲他的接班人。

sentences.english: We must train socialist Builders and successors featuring an all-round development in morality, intelligence, physique and art.
sentences.chinese: 培養德智體美全面發展的社會主義建設者和接班人。

sentences.english: We are trying our best to develop a system of collective leadership and a flow of successors.
sentences.chinese: 我們努力在發展集體領導體系及連續的接班人們出現。

sentences.english: We must train and bring up millions of successors to our revolutionary cause.
sentences.chinese: 我們必培養和造就千百萬革命事業的接班人。

sentences.english: Marchetti has been tipped to follow in the footsteps of Juventus ace Gianluigi Buffon.
sentences.chinese: 馬爾凱蒂被認爲是尤文圖斯的王牌布馮的接班人。

sentences.english: In addition, inter-Korean relations and succession issues are not involved.
sentences.chinese: 此外朝韓關係及接班人問題等也沒有涉及。

sentences.english: The chairman has designated her as his successor.
sentences.chinese: 主席已指定她作爲他的接班人。

definition: to take over (from those working the previous shift)/to take over (in a leadership role etc)/to succeed sb
(astronomy) giant star/(fig.) superstar (of opera, basketball etc)
spiritual leader (of a nation or church)/religious leader
to replace/to take over (a position or post)
the cassock and alms bowl of a Buddhist master passed on to the favorite disciple (Buddhism)/legacy/mantle
Cenozoic (geological era covering the last 65m years)
to select sb for a position without announcing the decision until later/to decide behind closed doors/all cut and dried
seat of honor/person in a high-ranking position/to be promoted to a more senior role/(genetics) epistatic
compiled and published by Imperial command (old)
